title: Macron, an omnipresent absentee from the march against anti-Semitism in Paris
summary: Although he decided not to take part in Sunday's demonstration, which brought together over 100,000 people, the president spoke about the issue several times over the weekend.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Biden says Gaza hospital 'must be protected'
summary: Thousands fled Gaza’s Al-Shifa hospital over the weekend as Israeli troops encircled it, and doctors said gunfire and explosions raged all around it Monday. A position forcing US president Joe Biden to call for less intrusive action against Hamas

title: London-based Palestinian journalist Ahmed Alnaouq has lost 21 family members in Gaza
summary: Alnaouq was part of the team that founded the website We Are Not Numbers, providing many young Gazans with an outlet to talk about their daily hardships, as well as the Facebook page Across the Wall where stories of young Palestinians were translated into Hebrew.

title: UK PM Rishi Sunak dismisses Suella Braverman, brings in David Cameron
summary: The interior minister is ousted after criticizing the police and challenging the prime minister's authority. David Cameron, a former prime minister under whose watch the Brexit campaign won, is appointed foreign secretary.

title: France's 'Task Force 19' trains 'highly motivated' Ukrainian soldiers
summary: The French army has set up a detachment to train Ukrainian recruits, most of them volunteers, in infantry combat in a camp in central France.

title: Estonian education and research minister: 'AI is within our education system already'
summary: Since its independence, the smallest of the Baltic States has built up digital public services and continues to innovate in this field, explains Kristina Kallas.

title: UNICEF executive director: Gaza is a 'graveyard for children'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Catherine Russell says that children in Gaza are in a 'terrible situation,' as the Israeli forces continue bombarding the Strip.

title: Ukrainian women call for husbands' demobilization after 18 months of war
summary: In Maidan Square, as in the rest of Ukraine, women have been demonstrating for two weeks for the return and replacement of the men who left for the front in the early hours of the Russian invasion.

title: Over a hundred American birds will soon be renamed
summary: The American Ornithological Society wants to rename birds named after people, especially those with racist or offensive pasts, naming them instead for their physical characteristics.

title: Polish pro-EU candidate elected speaker of parliament
summary: Szymon Holownia was elected Marshal of the Sejm – the speaker of the Polish lower house – in a victory for Poland's three united pro-EU parties.

title: Madonna's Paris show: From Celebration to boredom
summary: The American artist's Paris concert took in a career spanning 40 years. Madonna has three more shows in the French capital, on November 13, 19 and 20.

title: Nord Stream: Media investigation finds Ukrainian officer coordinated pipeline sabotage
summary: According to Der Spiegel and the Washington Post, Colonel Chervinsky headed the team that blew up the two Baltic Sea pipelines in September 2022. Chervinsky has denied his role in this embarrassing affair.

title: Eight minors arrested in France over anti-Semitic metro chants
summary: The eight minors were filmed chanting anti-Semitic slogans in the Paris metro on October 31.

title: French MPs failed to declare trips paid by Qatar
summary: The president of the France-Qatar friendship group failed to declare two trips to the emirate for the Football World Cup, in December 2022, and delayed doing so for a trip to the Qatar Formula 1 Grand Prix in October. Three other MPs are under similar scrutiny.

title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia inaugurates four new towers
summary: The basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí has been 141 years in the making, but it has come one step closer to completion with the blessing of the four Towers of the Evangelists.

title: In Lebanon, Palestinians show solidarity with Hamas
summary: Supporters of the Islamist organisation want Arab countries to be more involved in support of Gaza.

title: Six presidential candidates in Madagascar call for election boycott
summary: Madagascar's political crisis deepens, as six candidates promise to snub the country's highly contested presidential election due to take place on November 16, 2023.

title: Macron hosts religious leaders to discuss fight against anti-Semitism
summary: The French president met with leaders from several faiths one day after a large march 'for the republic and against anti-Semitism,' which he did not attend.

title: Five waterside restaurants in Paris and the Ile-de-France region
summary: On the banks of the Marne or the Canal de l'Ourcq, on a terrace with a view or in the shade of a large oak tree, you'll find reimagined classics and chef's surprises.

title: Content moderation: key facts to learn from Facebook, Instagram, X, and TikTok transparency reports
summary: Transparency reports, which have become mandatory since the DSA came into effect, reveal some of the inner workings of the major social media companies, including their number of human moderators, their error rates, and how quickly they comply with EU member states' requests.

title: US Supreme Court adopts ethics code after scandals
summary: The policy, agreed to by all nine justices, does not appear to impose any significant new requirements and leaves compliance entirely to each justice.

title: 1962 Ferrari sells for $51.7 million, second most expensive car ever sold at auction
summary: The bright red roadster had been the property of an American collector for the past 38 years.

title: In Casablanca, parents go all out for their children's birthdays
summary: In Morocco's economic capital, some families spend thousands of dirhams for their child, usually enrolled in an expensive foreign school, to blow out their candles.

title: Concerns arise as digital giants' race for AI domination heightens
summary: American digital players Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Meta are taking the lion's share of the artificial intelligence market, raising the question of government regulation of this strategic sector.

title: 'Not everyone will go back to the kibbutz': The displaced Israelis now living in Dead Sea resorts
summary: Gathered in a hotel on the Dead Sea, 900 survivors of one of the kibbutzim attacked by Hamas on October 7 mourn their dead while waiting to be rehoused. Some feel like they have been left to fend for themselves after the massacres.

title: France links 2024 Olympic smear campaign to Azerbaijan
summary: According to a report by French government watchdog Viginum, a 'coordinated maneuver' by around 90 accounts with links to Azerbaijan shared 'visuals calling for a boycott of the 2024 Olympics' on July 26 and 27.

title: Ex-doctor goes on trial in France over Rwanda genocide
summary: Sosthene Munyemana, 68, is accused of organizing torture and killings during the genocide of Tutsis in Rwanda. He has lived in France since 1994.

title: In Russia, pardoned murderers are returning from the front – and reoffending
summary: At least 17 Russians convicted of murder received a pardon from Russian President Vladimir Putin after fighting in Ukraine. And at least three have already killed again.

title: Sixty European banks suspected of influencing tensions in South Sudan
summary: The NGO Global Witness accused Deutsche Bank, Alliance, ING, and five major French financial establishments of financing two Chinese and Malaysian oil groups implicated in violence affecting the African country in the grip of civil war since 2013.

title: Anti-Semitic acts in France rise to 1,500 since October 7
summary: France's Jewish population, the largest in Europe, has been targeted by a wave of anti-Semitism, despite the large turnout at a march against this discrimination on Sunday, October 12.

title: Adam Kadyrov, Marina Yandieva: Two faces of the rule of law in Russia
summary: Adam, the son of Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov, has received praise ever since he was filmed violently beating a student. Marina, a young woman from the neighboring territory of Ingushetia, had to flee domestic violence and remains under threat.

title: Paris 2024: Tahiti residents question Olympics' impact on surfing spot
summary: The choice of Teahupo'o as the venue for the surfing event delighted fans. But many Tahitians are opposed to the construction of new infrastructure on this site for the Games, because of the irreparable damage to the coral reef ecosystem.

title: After the coup in Gabon, the transition of power is in search of balance
summary: Brice Oligui Nguema, the country's new strongman, has reached out to the opposition and those close to deposed president Ali Bongo Ondimba while granting himself vast powers in the transitional government.

title: 250 flood-hit northern France towns in state of disaster
summary: President Emmanuel Macron said a state of natural disaster would be declared after heavy rains caused floods in the north of France. A €50 million fund will be made available to them.

title: Tour de France 2025 edition will start from Lille
summary: The cycling race's 'Grand Départ' will be given from the northern French city, after three consecutive starts outside the country.

title: How dirty money and Russian riches flow through Cyprus, a gateway to the EU
summary: Tax advantages. Golden visas. Judicial leniency. The Cyprus Confidential investigation by Le Monde and its partners, based on leaks, sheds light on how the island's economic model was allowed abuses, despite warnings from anti-fraud watchdogs.

title: German journalist was paid by Russian oligarch for pro-Putin books
summary: Confidential documents from the Cyprus Confidential investigation reveal that Hubert Seipel, known for his pro-Kremlin stance, received €600,000 from an offshore company linked to Russian billionaire Alexei Mordashov.

title: Russian convicted over journalist's murder pardoned for fighting in Ukraine
summary: Sergei Khadzhikurbanov was convicted of killing journalist Anna Politkovskaya in 2006. The Kremlin has acknowledged the use of prisoner recruits to fight in Ukraine and said convicts who 'atone for their crime on the battlefield with blood' could be pardoned.

title: Mali junta says it has 'seized' rebel stronghold of Kidal
summary: Mali's army said it had entered the northern town of Kidal, which has often been a stronghold of Tuareg-dominated rebel groups.

title: French Sénat approves immigration bill after toughening it
summary: The Sénat amended the government's plan, shifting the bill's measures more to the right. The bill will be debated in the Assemblée Nationale in December.

title: Rothko, painter of the intimate and the intense
summary: In the abstract pieces he conceived after the war, which are on display at the Fondation Louis Vuitton until April 2, 2024, the American artist who rejected all labels sought to connect directly to the purity of human emotion.
